intro: Antennaria andina, commonly known as the Andean willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant has a low-growing habit with hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine, white hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, and it produces small, achene-like seeds. Antennaria andina is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils.
